issue_comments.body:
I was able to post a comment, so idk what would be happening.
Can you try again?

That `This is my site` checkbox I don't think does anything. Also, clearly other people were able to post answers, comments, and questions, so it has something to do with your particular client/computer. I was able to post this question with the `This is my site` thing off on both ZeroExchange and the topic:
 [/1PHBjZSAc6mHDMkySJNs3XeSXUL7eY7Q7W/?/17PRT7jHB4TN1PMzgWbxDQYrUnWKX2bNcM/12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu/1514289664859](/1PHBjZSAc6mHDMkySJNs3XeSXUL7eY7Q7W/?/17PRT7jHB4TN1PMzgWbxDQYrUnWKX2bNcM/12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu/1514289664859)
So, no, I am *not* able to reproduce this.
Make sure you are logged in and that it says your name in the menu bar (or sidebar if on mobile). If it does not say your name, but instead "Login", then you need to click login again.
Try it now. I just republished the user content.json file of all topics because *maybe* your client didn't get the updated versions or something. That's the only thing I can think of.

I said I `didn't think` it did anything. Also, in order for it to have done anything, you would have had to make the assumption that files belonging to the zite owner/someone else were being modified. But that would be impossible if other people were able to post stuff.

Btw, this is why you don't go saying a zite is "broken" without fully knowing the situation.

Yeah, I know. I have just been taking a break from programming for a bit.
I've known about it since I released ZeroExchange, I just haven't bothered to fix it yet.
I have just released a new commit that fixes this. Btw, it was only *one* page where the ZeroId was shown.
Do you mean like a numbered list? If so, I believe that is a css problem with the ui framework I'm using.
I believe it does search tags, I just don't display the tags. I'll look into this to make sure, but judging by the code that I looked at, it should.
Editing hasn't been implemented yet. I'll be working on this next. Thanks for all of your feedback/bug reports!
